verses.text: When a man takes a wife and marries her, and she does not find favor in his eyes because he has found something indecent in her, he must write her a certificate of divorce, put it in her hand, and send her out from his house.
verses.comment: The word 'indecent' translates the Hebrew 'ʿervat dābār', implying sexual immorality but not explicitly adultery.

verses.text: When she has departed from his house, and goes and becomes another man's wife,
and the latter man dislikes her, writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her out of his house, or if the latter man who took her to be his wife dies,
verses.comment: Stresses the step-by-step process for remarriage and divorce.

verses.text: then her first husband who sent her away may not take her again to be his wife, after she has been defiled. For that is an abomination before the LORD. You are not to bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
verses.comment: ‘Defiled’ refers to remarriage; abomination references Levitical purity.

verses.text: When a man has taken a new wife, he shall not go out with the army or be liable for any duty. He shall be free at home for one year to be happy with his wife whom he has taken.
verses.comment: Consistency with military exemptions; 'happy with his wife' is literal.

verses.text: No one shall take a millstone or an upper millstone as a pledge, for he would be taking a life in pledge.
verses.comment: Millstones essential for daily food; 'life in pledge' = basic means of living.

verses.text: If a man is found kidnapping any of his brothers from the people of Israel, treating him as a slave or selling him, then that kidnapper must die. So you shall purge the evil from among you.
Take care in cases of leprous disease, to carefully do according to all that the Levitical priests instruct you. As I commanded them, so you shall be careful to do.
verses.comment: 'Leprous disease' covers various skin diseases in Hebrew.

verses.text: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the way as you came out of Egypt.
When you make your neighbor a loan of any sort, you shall not go into his house to take his pledge.
You shall stand outside, and the man to whom you make the loan shall bring the pledge out to you.
If he is a poor man, you shall not sleep with his pledge.
verses.comment: 'Sleep with his pledge' means not keeping his cloak overnight.

verses.text: You must surely return the pledge to him at sunset, so he may sleep in his cloak and bless you. It will be righteousness for you before the LORD your God.
verses.comment: 'Righteousness' here means an act of mercy and justice.

verses.text: You shall not oppress a hired servant who is poor and needy, whether he is one of your brothers or one of the sojourners who are in your land within your gates.
You shall give him his wages on the same day, before the sun sets; for he is poor and sets his heart on it—let him not cry out against you to the LORD, and you become guilty of sin.
Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children be put to death for their fathers; each one shall be put to death for his own sin.
You shall not pervert the justice due to the foreigner or to the fatherless, or take a widow’s garment as a pledge,
But you shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you from there; therefore I command you to do this.

When you reap your harvest in your field and have forgotten a sheaf in the field, you shall not go back to get it. It shall be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
verses.comment: 'Sheaf' is a bundle of harvested grain.

verses.text: When you beat your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs again. It shall be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.
When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you shall not glean it afterward. It shall be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.
verses.comment: 'Glean' is gather what is left after harvesters.

verses.text: You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore I command you to do this.
